chapter.title: Vendor Attribute Maintenance E-Docs
chapter.para: The Maintenance Menu provides access to many vendor-related e-docs that allow you to update vendor attributes used by the Vendor document.

section.title: Address Type Address Type document

para.emphasis:
> Address Type
> Address Type Lookup
> Address Type

section.para: The Address Type document is used to establish codes used to categorize various types of vendor addresses. These types can be used to identify different addresses for different purposes, such as defining one address to which purchase orders should be sent and another address to which tax documents should be addressed.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Address Type document includes the Edit Address Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Address Type tab definition

entry.para: The code to identify a type of vendor address.
Required. The familiar title of the vendor addresses type.
Optional. Select the checkbox if an address of this type can be marked as the default address for a vendor. Clear the checkbox if it should not be used as a default.
Indicates whether this vendor address is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Campus Campus Parameter document

para.emphasis:
> Campus
> Campus Parameter Lookup
> Campus Parameter

section.para: The Campus document defines basic identifying attributes of a campus-level purchasing unit at your institution.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Campus Parameter document includes the Edit Campus Parameter tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Campus Parameter tab definition

entry.para: The campus code for which the parameters are used.
The name of the purchasing director associated with this campus.

note.para: If the Director's name and title are supplied, they will also appear on the printed pdf version of the Purchase Order

entry.para: The title of the purchasing director for this campus.

note.para: If the Director's name and title are supplied, they will also appear on the printed pdf version of the Purchase Order

entry.para: The accounts payable email address for this campus.
The institution's name that is associated with this campus code.
The Purchasing Department name for this campus.
The first line of the address for this campus office.
The second line of the address for this campus office.
The city for this campus office.

The state for this campus office. Existing state codes may be retrieved from the list or from the lookup
.
The postal code for this campus office.

The country for this campus office. Existing restricted status codes may be retrieved from the list or from the lookup
.
Indicates whether this campus parameter is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Contact Type Contact Type document

para.emphasis:
> Contact Type
> Contact Type Lookup
> Contact Type

section.para: The Contact Type document is used to establish various roles of the vendor contact, which may assist in determining how inquiries should be directed to the vendor. Examples of contact types include 'Accounts Receivable,' 'Sales Rep,' and 'Customer Service.'

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Contact Type document includes the Edit Contact Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections of this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Contact Type tab definition

entry.para: The code used to identify a type of vendor contact.
Required. The title of the contact type.
Indicates whether this contact type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Contract Manager Contract Manager document

para.emphasis:
> Contract Manager
> Contract Manager Lookup
> Contract Manager

section.para: The Contract Manager document is used to establish the list of individuals at the institution who are responsible for managing contracts for specific vendors. When associating a contract with a vendor in the Vendor document, a Contract Manager must be selected.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Contract Manager document includes the Edit Contract Manager tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Contract Manager tab definition

entry.para: The code used to identify this contract manager.
The published phone number of the contract manager, including area code.
Required. The published fax number of the contract manager, including area code.
Required. The upper dollar amount for which this contract manager is allowed to delegate approval authority.
Indicates whether this contract manager is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Cost Source Purchase Order Cost Source document

para.emphasis:
> Cost Source
> Cost Source Lookup
> Cost Source

section.para: The Cost Source document is used to establish codes that identify the method used to determine the pricing for a purchase order. Examples might include 'Quote', 'Estimate', 'Pricing Agreement', or the name of an affiliation that has negotiated a contract with one or more vendors.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Cost Source document includes the Edit Cost Source tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Cost Source tab definition

entry.para: The code used to identify this purchase order cost source.
Required. The familiar title of the purchase order cost source.
Item Unit Price Lower Variance Percent
Required. Payment will not be made if the price variance is lower by this percentage.
Item Unit Price Upper Variance Percent
Required. Payment will not be made if the price variance is higher by this percentage.
Indicates whether this cost source code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Payment Terms Type Payment Term Type document

para.emphasis:
> Payment Terms Type
> Payment Terms Type Lookup
> Payment Terms Type

section.para: The Payment Terms Type document is used to establish codes that define a vendor's payment terms, including the number of days in which a payment is due and if a discount is available for prompt payment.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Payment Terms Type document includes the Edit Payment Term Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Payment Term Type tab definition

entry.para: Required. Enter the code used to identify this payment terms type.
Required. Enter the familiar title of the payment terms.
Required. Enter the percentage discount to be applied if the payment is made by the discount date.
Required. Enter a number that reflects either the number of days or the date (day of the month) by which payment must be made to qualify for the discount percentage.
Required. Select 'Days' or 'Date' to indicate whether the number entered in the Vendor Discount Due Number field is a number of days or a date (defined here as a specific day of the month).
Required. Enter a number that reflects either the number of days or the date (day of the month) by which payment net is due.
Required. Select 'Days' or 'Date' to indicate whether the number entered in the Vendor Net Due Number field is a number of days or a date (defined here as a specific day of the month).
Optional. Select the check box if the payment term type is active. Clear the check box to inactivate the existing payment terms code.

section.title: Phone Type Phone Type document

para.emphasis:
> Phone Type
> Phone Type Lookup
> Phone Type

section.para: The Phone Type document is used to establish codes that identify various types of vendor phone or fax numbers. Sample phone types might be 'Phone,' 'Fax,' or 'Mobile.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Phone Type document includes the Edit Phone Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Phone Type tab definition

entry.para: The code used to identify this phone type.
Required. The familiar title of the phone type.
Indicates whether this phone type code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Shipping Payment Terms Shipping Payment Terms document

para.emphasis:
> Shipping Payment Terms
> Shipping Payment Terms Lookup
> Shipping Payment Terms

section.para: The Shipping Payment Terms document establishes codes that define the various terms that specify who is responsible for the payment of shipping charges for purchases from a vendor. Examples might include 'Institute Pays, Part of PO,' 'Paid by 3rd Party,' or 'Vendor Pays'.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Shipping Payment Terms document includes the Edit Shipping Payment Terms tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Shipping Payment Terms tab definition

entry.para: The code used to identify the shipping payment terms.
Required. The title of the shipping payment terms.
Indicates if it is permissible for the vendor to add shipping charges to an invoice. Remove check mark if shipping payment terms does not apply to payments.
Indicates whether this shipping payment terms code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Shipping Special Conditions Shipping Special Conditions document

para.emphasis:
> Shipping Special Conditions
> Shipping Special Conditions Lookup
> Shipping Special Conditions

section.para: The Shipping Special Conditions document establishes various categories of commodities that require special shipping considerations. Examples might include 'Express' or 'Insured'.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Shipping Special Conditions document includes the Edit Shipping Special Condition tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Shipping Special Condition tab definition

entry.para: The code used to identify the shipping special condition.
Required. The familiar title of the shipping special condition.
Indicates whether this shipping special condition code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Shipping Title Shipping Title document

para.emphasis:
> Shipping Title
> Shipping Title Lookup
> Shipping Title

section.para: The Shipping Title document establishes the codes that define the point at which shipping titles are transferred and the institution takes possession of a shipment. Examples might include 'Destination,' 'Origin (Vendor Location),' or 'Customs-US Port.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Shipping Title document includes the Edit Shipping Title Tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Shipping Title tab definition

entry.para: The code used to identify this vendor shipping title.
Required. The familiar title of the vendor shipping title.
Indicates whether this shipping title code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Supplier Diversity Supplier Diversity document

para.emphasis:
> Supplier Diversity
> Supplier Diversity Lookup
> Supplier Diversity

section.para: Certain vendors may merit special consideration due to their size (small business), ownership (woman or minority owned), geographical location (local), or other factors. The Supplier Diversity document establishes the codes to identify the categories defined by the Small Business Administration.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Supplier Diversity document includes the Edit Supplier Diversity tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Supplier Diversity tab definition

entry.para: The code used to identify this supplier diversity type.
Required. The title of the supplier diversity code.
Indicates whether this supplier diversity code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Vendor Inactive Reason Vendor Inactive Reason document

para.emphasis:
> Vendor Inactive Reason
> Vendor Inactive Reason Lookup
> Vendor Inactive Reason

section.para: The Vendor Inactive Reason document establishes codes that indicate why a vendor is being inactivated in the system. Examples of codes might include 'Out of Business' or 'Merged.'

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Vendor Inactive Reason document includes the Edit Vendor Inactive Reason tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Vendor Inactive Reason tab definition

entry.para: The code used to identify this vendor inactive reason.
Required. The familiar title of the vendor inactive reason code.
Indicates whether this vendor inactive reason code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Vendor Search Alias Type Vendor Inactive Reason document

para.emphasis:
> Vendor Search Alias Type
> Alias Type Lookup
> Alias Type

section.para: The Vendor Search Alias Type document establishes codes that indicate what type of vendor alias is used on the Vendor document. Examples of codes might include 'Abbreviation' or 'External Vendor Code.'

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Vendor Alias Type document includes the Edit Alias Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Alias Type tab definition

entry.para: Required. The name of the alias type used to describe aliases.
Required. The description of the alias type.
Indicates whether this alias type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Vendor Transmission Format Vendor Inactive Reason document

para.emphasis:
> Vendor Transmission Format
> Transmission Format Lookup
> Vendor Transmission Format

section.para: The Vendor Transmission Format document establishes the file formats that a vendor will use to receive purchase orders. Examples of formats might include EDI or 'PDF'.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Vendor Transmission Format document includes the Edit Vendor Transmission Format tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Vendor Transmission Format tab definition

entry.para: Required. The name of the vendor transmission format.
Indicates whether this vendor inactive reason code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Vendor Transmission Type Vendor Inactive Reason document

para.emphasis:
> Vendor Transmission Type
> Transmission Type Lookup
> Vendor Transmission Type

section.para: The Vendor Transmission Type document establishes how a purchase order will be sent to the vendor. Examples of transmission types might include 'FTP', Email, or 'Fax'.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Vendor Transmission Type document includes the Edit Vendor Transmission Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Edit Vendor Transmission Type tab definition

entry.para: Required. The familiar name of the transmission type.
Indicates whether this vendor inactive reason code is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.
